cmCourseInfo.description:
An introduction to the main elements of the Italian language. The development of speaking, reading, and writing skills. Introduction to Italian culture and texts.

A questionnaire on students' knowledge of and background in Italian will be administered shortly before or during the first class.
cmCourseInfo.title: Italian Language for Beginners
cmCourseInfo.exclusionsText: Grade 11 and/or 12 Italian (U or M level) or previous experience or instruction in Italian.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

This course features the flipped classroom method.

Delivery Instructions

This course also features a shared, pre-recorded asynchronous component delivered online to all students in the course. This component will take on average about one hour per session. This section of the course is self-paced and not reliant on a meeting schedule, but students will have to complete it before the active learning sessions of the course (consisting of two 2-hour sessions per week), which are live-streamed, delivered synchronously per the meeting schedule. Students need to use several functions within Quercus (Discussion Boards, assignments), the ability to use MS Teams and/or Zoom for interactive sessions, a webcam, and a microphone. Students are expected to keep cameras on for the entire duration of the synchronous sessions.

cmCourseInfo.description: The course illustrates Italy's contribution to the history of the trope during a time when countries became increasingly interdependent and conscious of each other's cultures. Through literary and social analysis the course traces the most vital aspects of the journey motif. This course includes a component designed to enhance students' research experience. (Given in English)
cmCourseInfo.title: The 'Journey' in 19th Century Italian Literature

cmCourseInfo.description: Based on a professor’s research project currently in progress, this course will enable an undergraduate student to play a useful role in the project while receiving concrete training in research. This course is mandatory for all students enrolled in the specialist’s program.
cmCourseInfo.title: Directed Research
